Yes, I can provide information on the most affordable public transportation option in Santa Monica, California.

The most affordable public transportation option in Santa Monica is the Big Blue Bus. The base fare is $1.25, and discounts are available for seniors, students, and disabled riders. Additionally, children under the age of 5 ride for free. Since the Big Blue Bus operates primarily within Santa Monica, it is a cost-effective option for locals and visitors who want to explore the city.

Los Angeles Metro is also an affordable option. A single ride on the Metro bus or rail costs $1.75, while a day pass is priced at $7. The Metro is the best option for travelers who plan to explore beyond Santa Monica, as it provides access to other parts of Los Angeles County.

In comparison, Breeze Bike Share, PEV, and electric bicycle share programs can be more expensive, costing anywhere between $1-$2 to unlock a bike or scooter, with additional fees charged per minute of usage. Ride-sharing services like Uber and Lyft are also generally more expensive than public transportation, especially during peak hours.

In summary, the Big Blue Bus and Los Angeles Metro are the most affordable public transportation options in Santa Monica, making them an excellent choice for budget-conscious travelers or locals.
